subject: Re: [junit] Non Plus Ultra Coverage Measure?
msgSnippet: ... There s an example I always recall when I hear coverage (taken from the V. Binder book):  int scale(int j) { j = j - 1;  // should be j=j+1
messageBody:
> And is there a ranking of coverage measures in terms of how much
> they cover compared to the other measures?

There's an example I always recall when I hear "coverage" (taken from
the V. Binder book):

<-- quote -->

int scale(int j) {
j = j - 1; // should be j=j+1
j = j/3000;
return j;
}

Out of 65,536 possible values of j, only 6 will produce an incorrect
result: -30001, -3000, -1, 0, 2999 and 3000. We could do
near-exhaustive testing of this code, covering 99.9908 percent of all
input values, and still not reveal the bug.

<-- end of quote -->

100% code coverage (testing one single input value already gives 100%
code coverage) doesn't mean no bug.

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir R. Bossicard
www.bossicard.com
